content.text:
# Acer wardii

|genus = Acer
|parent = Acer sect. Wardiana
|species = wardii
|authority =W.W.Sm. 1917
|synonyms_ref =
|synonyms = *Acer mirabile Hand.-Mazz.
}}
Acer wardii is an uncommon Asian species of maple. It is found at high elevations (2400–3600 m) in Tibet, Yunnan, Myanmar, and Assam.[http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon_id=200013141 Flora of China, Acer wardii W. W. Smith, 1917. 滇藏枫 dian zang feng ]
Acer wardii is a deciduous shrub or small tree up to 5 meters tall with dark gray bark. Leaves are non-compound, up to 9 cm wide and 8 cm across, thin and papery, with 3 lobes and many small teeth.
